src/par_IO.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*
00002  *                                                                    *
00003  *  By Robert Hallberg, August 1998                                   *
00004  *                                                                    *
00005  *    This program various subroutines which are necessary to make    *
00006  *  the model run on a parallel computer.  Each of these subroutines  *
00007  *  except set_up_parallel is also called when not on a parallel      *
00008  *  computer, but in that case the subroutines are quite simple.      *
00009  *                                                                    *
00010  *    collect_double_fields takes whichever field it is given and     *
00011  *  collects it into io_field_d.                                      *
00012  *                                                                    *
00013  *    spread_double_fields distributes one layer's worth of data to   *
00014  *  the appropriate locations on each processor.                      *
00015  *                                                                    *
00016  *    sum_fields does a sum across all processors of the vector       *
00017  *  indicated by the first argument with a length given by its second *
00018  *  argument, and returns these sums in that vector.                  *
00019  *                                                                    *
00020  ********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*/
00021 
00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include "init.h"
00024 #include <stdlib.h>
00025 
00026 
00027 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00028 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00029 #include <mpi.h>
00030 # else
00031 #include <mpp/shmem.h>
00032 # endif
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 
00036 extern double io_field_d[(NXTOT+1)*(NYTOT+1)]; /* A global field that */
00037                                      /* is used in all double pre-    */
00038                                      /* cision I/O.                   */
00039 #ifdef PARALLEL_X
00040 extern int nx;                       /* The number of x-points in the */
00041                                      /* physical domain calculated by */
00042                                      /* the current processor.        */
00043 extern int X0abs;                    /* The absolute index of X0 on   */
00044                                      /* the current processor, rel-   */
00045                                      /* ative to X0 on processor 0.   */
00046 #else
00047 # ifdef PARALLEL_Y
00048 static int X0abs = 0;                /* On 1 processor, X0abs = 0.    */
00049 # endif
00050 #endif
00051 #ifdef PARALLEL_Y
00052 extern int ny;                       /* The number of y-points in the */
00053                                      /* physical domain calculated by */
00054                                      /* the current processor.        */
00055 extern int Y0abs;                    /* The absolute index of Y0 on   */
00056                                      /* the current processor, rel-   */
00057                                      /* ative to Y0 on processor 0.   */
00058 #else
00059 # ifdef PARALLEL_X
00060 static int Y0abs = 0;                /* On 1 processor, Y0abs = 0.    */
00061 # endif
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00065 # ifndef MAXPROC
00066 #  ifndef NXPROC
00067 #   define NXPROC 1
00068 #  endif
00069 #  ifndef NYPROC
00070 #   define NYPROC 1
00071 #  endif
00072 #  define MAXPROC ((NXPROC)*(NYPROC))
00073 # endif
00074 # ifdef CHECKPARALLEL
00075 #  define MAXPROCS ((MAXPROC)+1)
00076 # else
00077 #  define MAXPROCS (MAXPROC)
00078 # endif
00079 extern int pe_here;                  /* The current processor's label.*/
00080 extern int X0abs_proc[MAXPROCS]; /* The absolute index of X0 on each  */
00081                                  /* processor relative to X0 on       */
00082                                  /* processor 0.                      */
00083 extern int Y0abs_proc[MAXPROCS]; /* The absolute index of Y0 on each  */
00084                                  /* processor relative to Y0 on       */
00085                                  /* processor 0.                      */
00086 extern int nx_proc[MAXPROCS];    /* The number of points in the comp- */
00087 extern int ny_proc[MAXPROCS];    /* utational domain of each processor*/
00088                                  /* in the x- and y- directions.      */
00089 extern int procs_used;           /* The number of processors actually */
00090                                  /* used in the present simulation.   */
00091 extern int procs_used_all;       /* procs_used_all equals procs_used  */
00092                                  /* unless CHECKPARALLEL is used, in  */
00093                                  /* which case it is 1 greater.       */
00094 #else
00095 #define pe_here 0                    /* Without running in parallel,  */
00096                                      /* the current processor is 0.   */
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 
00100 void collect_double_fields(double *field_in, int offx, int offy)
00101 {
00102 /*   Gather a layer's worth of field_in from every processor, and put */
00103 /* it into io_field_d, with offsets offx, offy between the X0,Y0      */
00104 /* corner of the data and the southwest corner of io_field_d.         */
00105   int i, j;
00106 
00107 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00108 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00109   {
00110     if (pe_here == 0) {
00111       MPI_Request req[MAXPROC];
00112       MPI_Status stat;
00113       double pass_field[MAXPROC][NXMEM*NYMEM];
00114       int p, p2;
00115 
00116       for (p=1;p<procs_used;p++) {
00117         MPI_Irecv(pass_field[p], NXMEM*NYMEM, MPI_DOUBLE, p, (1000+p), MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req[p]);
00118       }
00119 
00120       for (i=X0+offx;i<=nx;i++) 
00121 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00122         for (j=Y0+offy;j<=ny;j++)
00123           io_field_d[(i-X0-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy)+j-Y0-offy] = field_in[NYMEM*i+j];
00124 
00125       for (p2=1;p2<procs_used;p2++) {
00126         MPI_Waitany(procs_used-1, &req[1], &p, &stat); p++;
00127         for (i=(((X0abs_proc[p]==0)&&(offx==0))?X0:X1);i<=nx_proc[p];i++) {
00128           for (j=(((Y0abs==0)&&(offy==0))?Y0:Y1);j<=ny_proc[p];j++) {
00129             io_field_d[(i+X0abs_proc[p]-X0-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy) + j+Y0abs_proc[p]-Y0-offy] =
00130               pass_field[p][NYMEM*i+j];
00131           }
00132         }
00133       }
00134     }
00135     else if (pe_here < procs_used) {
00136       MPI_Send(field_in, NXMEM*NYMEM, MPI_DOUBLE, 0, (1000+pe_here), MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00137     }
00138   }
00139 # else
00140   barrier();
00141   if (pe_here == 0) {
00142     for (i=X0+offx;i<=nx;i++) 
00143 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00144       for (j=Y0+offy;j<=ny;j++)
00145         io_field_d[(i-X0-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy)+j-Y0-offy] = field_in[NYMEM*i+j];
00146   }
00147   else {
00148     for (i=(((X0abs==0)&&(offx==0))?X0:X1);i<=nx;i++) {
00149       if ((Y0abs == 0) && (offy == 0))
00150         shmem_double_put(&io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy)],
00151                          field_in+NYMEM*i+Y0,ny+1-Y0,0);
00152       else
00153         shmem_double_put(&io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy) + Y0abs+1-offy],
00154                          field_in+NYMEM*i+Y0+offy,ny-Y0,0);
00155     }
00156   }
00157   barrier();
00158 
00159 # endif
00160 #else
00161   for (i=offx;i<=NXTOT;i++) for (j=offy;j<=NYTOT;j++)
00162     io_field_d[(i-offx)*(NYTOT+1-offy)+j-offy] = field_in[NYMEM*(i+X0)+j+Y0];
00163 #endif
00164 }
00165 
00166 void spread_double_fields(double field_out[][NYMEM])
00167 {
00168 /*   Distribute a layer's worth of io_field_d to the appropriate      */
00169 /* processors in field_out.                                           */
00170   int i, j;
00171 
00172 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00173 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00174   {
00175     if (pe_here == 0) {
00176       MPI_Request req[MAXPROCS];
00177       MPI_Status stat[MAXPROCS];
00178       double pass_field[MAXPROCS][NXMEM*NYMEM];
00179       int p, p2;
00180 
00181       for (p=0;p<procs_used_all;p++) {
00182         for (i=0;i<=nx_proc[p]-X0;i++) for (j=0;j<=ny_proc[p]-Y0;j++) {
00183           pass_field[p][NYMEM*i+j] =
00184               io_field_d[(i+X0abs_proc[p])*(NYTOT+1) + j+Y0abs_proc[p]];
00185         }
00186         MPI_Isend(pass_field[p], NXMEM*NYMEM, MPI_DOUBLE, p, (2000+p), MPI_COMM_WORLD, &req[p]);
00187       }
00188 
00189       for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++) 
00190 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00191         for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00192           field_out[i][j] = io_field_d[(i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+j-Y0];
00193 
00194       MPI_Waitall(procs_used_all, req, stat);
00195     }
00196     else {
00197       MPI_Status stat;
00198       double pass_field[NXMEM*NYMEM];
00199       MPI_Recv(pass_field, NXMEM*NYMEM, MPI_DOUBLE, 0, (2000+pe_here), MPI_COMM_WORLD, &stat);
00200       for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00201 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00202         for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00203           field_out[i][j] = pass_field[(i-X0)*NYMEM+j-Y0];
00204     }
00205   }
00206 # else
00207   barrier();
00208   if (pe_here == 0) {
00209     for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00210 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00211       for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00212         field_out[i][j] = io_field_d[(i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+j-Y0];
00213 
00214   }
00215   else {
00216     for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++) {
00217       shmem_double_get(&field_out[i][Y0],
00218                        &io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+Y0abs],ny-Y0+1,0);
00219     }
00220   }
00221   barrier();
00222 # endif
00223 #else
00224   for (i=0;i<=NXTOT;i++)
00225 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00226    for (j=0;j<=NYTOT;j++) field_out[i+X0][j+Y0]=io_field_d[i*(NYTOT+1)+j];
00227 #endif
00228 
00229 }
00230 
00231 void spread_double_vector(double vec[], int numpts)
00232 {
00233 /*   This copies the numpts points in vec on processor 0 to every     */
00234 /* vec on every other processor.                                      */
00235 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00236 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00237   MPI_Bcast(vec, numpts, MPI_DOUBLE, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00238 # else
00239   int i;
00240   if (pe_here == 0) 
00241 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00242     for (i=0;i<numpts;i++) io_field_d[i] = vec[i];
00243   barrier();
00244   if (pe_here != 0) {
00245     shmem_double_get(io_field_d,io_field_d,numpts,0);
00246 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00247     for (i=0;i<numpts;i++) vec[i] = io_field_d[i];
00248   }
00249   barrier();
00250 # endif
00251 #endif
00252 }
00253 
00254 size_t read_layer(double field_out[][NYMEM], FILE *file, int float_vals)
00255 {
00256 /*   Read in one layer's worth data from file and distribute it to    */
00257 /* the appropriate processors in field_out. float_vals is 1 if the    */
00258 /* input file contains floating point numbers and 0 otherwise.        */
00259   float float_in[NYTOT+1];     /* A column of a layer of a variable.  */
00260   int floatsize = sizeof(float);
00261   int i, j, fs = (NXTOT+1)*(NYTOT+1)*sizeof(double);
00262   size_t err;
00263 
00264 /* First PE 0 reads the data from file.                               */
00265 
00266   err = 1;
00267   if (pe_here == 0) {
00268     if (float_vals) {
00269       for (i=0;i<=NXTOT;i++) {
00270         err *= fread((void *)float_in,floatsize*(NYTOT+1),1,file);
00271         for (j=0;j<=NYTOT;j++) io_field_d[i*(NYTOT+1)+j] = (double) float_in[j];
00272       }
00273     }
00274     else {
00275       err = fread((void *)io_field_d,fs,1,file);
00276     }
00277   }
00278 
00279 /* Now each processor gathers its data from PE 0.                     */
00280 
00281 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00282 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00283     spread_double_fields(field_out);
00284 # else
00285   barrier();
00286   if (pe_here == 0) {
00287     for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00288 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00289       for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00290         field_out[i][j] = io_field_d[(i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+j-Y0];
00291   }
00292   else {
00293     for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++) {
00294       shmem_double_get(&field_out[i][Y0],
00295                        &io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+Y0abs],ny-Y0+1,0);
00296     }
00297   }
00298   barrier();
00299 
00300 # endif
00301 #else
00302   for (i=0;i<=NXTOT;i++) 
00303 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00304     for (j=0;j<=NYTOT;j++) field_out[i+X0][j+Y0] = io_field_d[i*(NYTOT+1)+j];
00305 #endif
00306 
00307   return(err);
00308 }
00309 
00310 size_t write_layer(double field_in[], FILE *file, int float_vals)
00311 {
00312 /*   Gather a layer's worth of field_in from every processor, and     */
00313 /* write it out to file.  float_vals is 1 if floating point numbers   */
00314 /* are to be written and 0 to write double precision numbers.         */
00315   float float_out[NYTOT+1];    /* A column of a layer of a variable.  */
00316   int floatsize = sizeof(float);
00317   int i, j, fs = (NXTOT+1)*(NYTOT+1)*sizeof(double);
00318   size_t err;
00319 
00320 /* Collect the data to PE 0.                                          */
00321 
00322 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00323 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00324     collect_double_fields(field_in, 0, 0);
00325 # else
00326   barrier();
00327   if (pe_here == 0) {
00328     for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00329 //#pragma _CRI ivdep
00330       for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00331         io_field_d[(i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)+j-Y0] = field_in[i*NYMEM+j];
00332   }
00333   else {
00334     for (i=((X0abs==0)?X0:X1);i<=nx;i++) {
00335       if (Y0abs == 0)
00336         shmem_double_put(&io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0)*(NYTOT+1)],
00337                          &field_in[i*NYMEM+Y0],ny-Y0+1,0);
00338       else
00339         shmem_double_put(&io_field_d[(X0abs+i-X0)*(NYTOT+1) + Y0abs+1],
00340                          &field_in[i*NYMEM+Y1],ny-Y0,0);
00341     }
00342   }
00343   barrier();
00344 
00345 # endif
00346 #else
00347   for (i=0;i<=NXTOT;i++) for (j=0;j<=NYTOT;j++)
00348     io_field_d[i*(NYTOT+1)+j] = field_in[(i+X0)*NYMEM+j+Y0];
00349 #endif
00350 
00351 /* Here PE 0 writes out the data.                                     */
00352 
00353   err = 1;
00354   if (pe_here==0) {
00355     if (float_vals) {
00356       for (i=0;i<=NXTOT;i++) {
00357         for (j=0;j<=NYTOT;j++) float_out[j] = (float) io_field_d[i*(NYTOT+1)+j];
00358         err *= fwrite((void *)float_out,floatsize*(NYTOT+1),1,file);
00359       }
00360     } else {
00361       err *= fwrite((void *)io_field_d,fs,1,file);
00362     }
00363   }
00364 
00365   return(err);
00366 }
00367 
00368 void quit(int status) {
00369 /* This subroutine calls the appropriate exit call to terminate the */
00370 /* execution on all processors.                                     */
00371 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00372 # ifdef MPI_PARALLEL
00373   MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, status);
00374 # else
00375   globalexit(status);
00376 # endif
00377 #else
00378   exit(status);
00379 #endif
00380 }
